course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Marine Biology Laboratory
course.description: Both laboratory and field investigations will provide the opportunity to apply and adapt the experimental methods developed here to specific groups of marine organisms, diversified marine habitats, and practical issues in marine/environmental science. Tutorial sessions and field trips will be used to enhance student's understanding of the practical work and the theories covered in the lectures.

reviews.author: Gravel
reviews.title: Grade ok, High workload
reviews.comment_content: A lot to learn, interesting to know. Content about different marine organisms, anatomy, ecological habitat, behaviour. Experiments to prove behaviour and field trip to find animals and plants in real life.
reviews.comment_teaching: Each bench different TA, each with different teaching quality. Some TA not familiar with course info, some TA very detailed. Depends on which TA you get. Cindy quite nice, very willing to answer questions. Lab tech give good answers and very helpful.
reviews.comment_grading: Is ok. Good to average grade but can get low if not try.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy workload. Need to read before lab and field tripmm otherwise dunno what to do and confused about animal anatomy and structure function. Two field trips to seaside and mangrove, tiring and a lot of effort. Need to do few pages lab report after each lab with calculation, drawing and some online research.

reviews.author: Emily
reviews.comment_content: different marine organisms (sea urchin, squid, cuttlefish, fish, worm)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Cindy is nice, willing to spend time answer questions if we find her at her office.
TA is good, patient to guide us!
Lucky to have good TA!
reviews.comment_grading:
5 lab reports 15% (3% each)
1 final exam 40%
2 field trip reports 20% (group based, 10% each)
2 group presentations 10% (5% each, one is about the field trip and one is any topics related to marine biology)
1 quiz 10% (test the first few lectures)
continuous assessment 5%
reviews.comment_workload:
high

lab reports: difficult, need find answers in the Net

field trip reports: time consuming, people will freeride, no peer evaluation

presentations: easy, 15 mins/group

Final: recite whole lab manual

reviews.author: NgSHO
reviews.title: Interesting Biology lab course
reviews.comment_content: You can enjoy some great experience in dissecting marine creatures, taking ecological survey. It would be interesting if you like the marine creatures and are curious about marine creatures.
reviews.comment_teaching: Each TA is responsible for one lab so some of the TA are not understand the details. If you have question, try to ask Cindy or Simon. They are really nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade given is fair, a normal lifs grading (mean about B-)

I got nearly full mark in field trip report and below mean in lab worksheet (idk the mean but I feel I am of lower mark). The presentation score should be more or less the same for all people.
I am below an SD in exam.
Finally got C+, I will blame myself for not remembering hard in exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
It's fair for a lab course.

One short lab worksheet per lab session, answering the question/drawing the observation of field trip environment and structure of the marine creatures. It is suggested to take a look at the worksheet before you do the lab so that you can write down some answers on the worksheet at that moment.
This part is pretty easy and normal for a lab course and Google can help you as well.

There are also two presentations about 1. the field trip and 2. a marine issue. The time of presentation is short so that the preparation can be easy.

The final examination is not difficult but it is necessary to revise the material well especially the worksheet of correct answer, so ask TA for the answer if you get something wrong. The time of examination is at late November.

This course did not require a full long report so the workload  is not that great i will say.

reviews.author: Leung
reviews.comment_content:
Cover different aspects of marine biology, from testing the % of salt in seawater to dissect different marine organisms (sea urchin, squid, cuttlefish, fish, worm; it may be changed)

There are two field trips, one is about the mudflat and one is about rocky shore.
reviews.comment_teaching: Don't expect the tutorial before the lab can teach you anything, the TA (PhD students) are responsible for this part, normally they are very busy so they won't have time to prepare it, just read the lab manual before the lab
reviews.comment_grading:
5 lab reports 15% (3% each)
1 final exam 40%
2 field trip reports 20% (group based, 10% each)
2 group presentations 10% (5% each, one is about the field trip and one is any topics related to marine biology)
1 quiz 10% (test the first few lectures)
continuous assessment 5%

I got almost full marks in two field trip report, ~mean in lab reports, >1sd in final exam, and almost full marks in quiz and finally got A range
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite huge:
lab reports: just answer questions, but some questions are challenging, you would need time to google the answer

field trip reports: time consuming, ready to spend nights on it before the deadline

presentations: relatively relax, ~12-15 mins/group, don't worry about it

Final: spend nights to digest all the stuff written in the lab manual
